user_question: Can you tell me about the physics behind a curveball in baseball and generate an image of a pitcher throwing a curveball?
final_answer: A curveball in baseball is thrown with a grip and wrist action that imparts topspin, causing the ball to dive as it approaches the plate due to the Magnus effect. The Magnus effect occurs when the topspin creates a pressure differential, with lower pressure on top and higher pressure on the bottom, causing the ball to drop. Image of a pitcher throwing a curveball generated.
